intro: Galium ehrenbergii, commonly known as the mountain bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Galium ehrenbergii is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-elevation ecosystems.
